Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 22:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 13 spans of cables and 12 poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on and around Woodlands Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 19:12 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power on the underground network in the Durants Road, EN3 7 area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 18:59 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that They have only now located the fault so have now started their excavations. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 21:30 and 22:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Roland at 17:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 18:44 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around a fault on the underground network in the Cherry Garden Lane area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage and how long you were off for. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 16:43 - Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to a fault on our underground electricity network which has affected our substation equipment, so we're sending a specialist team to pinpoint the fault and dig down to expose the cabling for repairs.

Considering the work that may be required, the revised estimated time to have the power back on is between 19:30 and 20:30.

We're sorry to change the time, but we'll keep you updated with our progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to talk on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 17:18
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Oak Grove area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 19:00 and 20:00; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Theo at 16:31.

Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Turner Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 06:19 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 2155 customers in the Tonbridge TN12 area, by diverting power around an overhead cable fault. We know power may have been off for a long time; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Hello, Talie from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Great news - Our engineers have now restored power to all 1051 customers in the SS11 and SS12 area by diverting power around three issues on the network.

Thank you for your patience while our team worked hard to resolve the issue safely. We apologise the outage lasted longer than anticipated and we appreciate your understanding.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:10 - Our engineers have restored power to all 682 properties in the Ramsden Park Road / Church Road area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the underground cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Ramsden Park Road / Church Road area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 33 customers. There are now 15 properties still affected and using an average time frame we're estimating all power will be on between 07:30 and 08:30, but this may change later depending on what our staff find. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Talie at 06:38.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:59 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Tonbridge TN12  area to investigate the power cut affecting 274 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Simon at 08:30.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 08:03 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 274 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 11:00 and 12:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 07:50. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 10-JAN-2026 12:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 08:35. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're currently investigating a fault on the electricity network which has caused a power cut in the local area.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  We are arranging to have engineers investigate the fault.  We are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
